data.title: [1.12.1] workbench.colorCustomizations - doesn't work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: win7x64

My customization of theme Dark+ (default dark) was disabled after update to ver. 1.12
So I opened settings.json file in "user settings" and saw a hint, that I should remove ".experimental" thing, cause it's already "stable". Well, I removed it, and still no effect!

```
"workbench.colorCustomizations": {
  
  "editorBackground": "#1a1a1a",
  "editorCursor": "#f00",      // cursor should be red, but it's not
  "editorLinkForeground": "#cccc00",      // links should be yellow, but it's not
  "editorLineHighlight": "#333333"
}
```

I have no green underlining hints or red "errors" in my settings file.
So, what am I doing wrong and why that's not working anymore?

data.title: Search and Replace optionally maintains case
data.body: Hello, this is a feature request. When performing a search and replace over multiple files, I would like the ability to (optionally) do case insensitive matches, but where the replacement maintains the case of the original text match. For example, if I want to search for "FooBar" and replace with "ConcreteObject", it would replace "fooBar" with "concreteObject" and "FooBar" with "ConcreteObject". This is useful because it helps with renaming both type declarations and local variable names.

data.title: Turn off Auto Formatting on save
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: Mac OSX Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a sass file and have variable like so : 
$standard: 'custom-font',Helvetica,Arial,sans-serif;

2. on save it adds a break after each comma. This is pretty annoying - how can I disable this because its making my code unreadable.. I've noticed similar behaviour with other languages but this has cropped up on more than one occasion. 

My user and Workspace settings have the following in both:

```
{
    "window.zoomLevel": 0,
    "files.associations": {
        "*.mustache": "handlebars"
    },
    "html.format.enable": false,
    "html.format.wrapLineLength": 0,
    "typescript.check.workspaceVersion": false,
    "editor.wordWrap": false,
    "workbench.colorTheme": "Monokai",
    "[cpp]": {
        "editor.quickSuggestions": false
    },
    "[c]": {
        "editor.quickSuggestions": false
    },
    "html.format.preserveNewLines": false,
    "typescript.format.enable": false,
    "typescript.format.insertSpaceAfterCommaDelimiter": false,
    "editor.trimAutoWhitespace": false,
    "css.validate": false,
    "scss.validate": false,
    "json.format.enable": false
}
```

data.title: Opening a file twice should not start a new instance of vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Opening a file from finder.
2. Opening the same file again in finder.

Expected behavior: Same as sublime. Focus on the instance already opened in vscode and not create a new duplicate window.

data.title: In TSLint section for settings.json, explain that many TSLint settings are elsewhere
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open File | Preferences | Settings
2.  Expand the TSLint section

The TSLint section has 11 settings but says nothing of the fact that there are many TSLint settings in a tslint.json file.  

Suggested resolution: At the top of the TSLint section of this explanatory file, include text such as:
"Many other TSLint settings can be changed in a separate tslint.json file"

This issue arose in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-tslint/issues/198 but the thread was closed immediately after the first response, without any opportunity to point out the underlying problem.

data.title: Multi-file search & replace incorrectly selecting contents based on regular expression
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|rainbow-brackets|2gua|0.0.6|;

---

Example file:

      "name": "Legion - Bronze - Teleporter",
      "to_build": "LegionStructureBasicTeleporter",
      "instance_count": 1,
      "priority": 1,
      "max_num_assisters": 10,
      "builders": [
        "LegionCommander",
        "AnyLegionFabberBasic",
        "AnyLegionFabberAdvanced",
        "LegionOrbitalBasicFabber"
      ],

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Switch to Search
2. Expand Search to include replace field
3. Enable regular expression
4. In FIND box enter: ,\n      "builders":
5. In REPLACE box enter: ,\n      "base_sort": "FromBuilder",\n      "builders":

EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR:

File will become as follows:

      "name": "Legion - Bronze - Teleporter",
      "to_build": "LegionStructureBasicTeleporter",
      "instance_count": 1,
      "priority": 1,
      "max_num_assisters": 10,
      "base_sort": "FromBuilder",
      "builders": [
        "LegionCommander",
        "AnyLegionFabberBasic",
        "AnyLegionFabberAdvanced",
        "LegionOrbitalBasicFabber"
      ],

CURRENT BEHAVIOUR:

File becomes the following:

      "name": "Legion - Bronze - Teleporter",
      "to_build": "LegionStructureBasicTeleporter",
      "instance_count": 1,
      "priority": 1,
      "max_num_as
      "base_sort": "FromBuilder",
      "builders":
      "builders": [
        "LegionCommander",
        "AnyLegionFabberBasic",
        "AnyLegionFabberAdvanced",
        "LegionOrbitalBasicFabber"
      ],

NOTE: use CTRL-H search & replace within a file behaves according to expected behaviour.

[example files.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/983399/example.files.zip)

data.title: Tabulations in makes snipets interpreter
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12
- OS Version: Ubuntu 17.04
- Extensions: Some are enabled in the example, but the bug is still here with them disabled
- DevTools: Nothing interesting.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a snipet (I use PHP in this example)
2. Include tabs in it. You already see the error "Excepted comma or closing bracket"
3. Try using it. It will isue some [object Object] for absolutly no reason

![Screen Capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16436883/25802015/b9c44d4a-33f0-11e7-9f44-6a1730869c4c.png)

In this example, I use the "Function description" snipet.

Edit: Partial fix to use tabs in snipets: using \t instead of a tab directly

data.title: Improve the debug toolbar placement
Explore how to support SSH based remote debugging
data.body:
If a debug extension wants to support for SSH based remote debugging it can roll its own implementation in the debug adapter of the extension.

We would like to support SSH based remote debugging in a generic way so that the debug extension only needs to support remote debugging and VS Code takes care of the SSH setup and shutdown.

data.title: CodeLens on hover
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.4 (16E195)

CodeLens could be on-demand, instead of always showing all references to all items, the references view could be shown on mouse over instead, or at least have an option for mouse over.  Now view feels very cluttered with it, but needs unnecessary steps if it's completely disabled.

data.title: Test: Link Detection in Exception Widget
data.body:
Ref: #21349, #24451

- [x]  Linux / Mac OS @sandy081  
- [x]  Windows @alexandrudima  

Complexity: 1

We have introduced the file link handling in the exception widget, with the code shared also between debug console. 

Produce the exception with links and verify:

1. Relative and absolute links that contain column (with `:` as a separator) are clickable and navigable (e.g. ./test.ts:13)
2. Relative and absolute links that contain both column and line number are clickable and navigable (e.g. ./test.ts:13:15)
3. Wrong links (those that link to nonexisting files) that are relative or absolute produce an error upon navigation.
4. Check for the same behaviour in the debug console. 

Be aware that DA can send a link in the relative format, although it is not relative to the workspace. In this case the link will be detected, however you should not be able to navigate to the file.

data.title: Enable auto-detection of SCM provider

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (with Hg extension installed!)
- OS Version: Windows 10 build 15063

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use 'Open Folder...' to navigate to a location within an existing Mercurial repository
2. Visual Studio Code doesn't automatically detect that the folder is part of a Mercurial repository, so keeps the Git SCM provider selected.

Admittedly, once Mercurial is selected for a folder, that setting is remembered. However, given the ease of detecting the presence of most mainstream SCM systems (Git, Hg, SVN), it's a shame that VS Code doesn't go that extra step and determine the SCM provider (if any) to use.

data.title: Incorrect Error Message reported in JS file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Debian Stretch

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make an Empty Folder and Open it in VSCode
2. Run `npm install safejson` in the same directory
3. Add `jsdoc.js` File to project, open it in VSCode
4. Paste contents of attached text file in it
[jsdoc.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/983039/jsdoc.txt)


I honestly don't know if this is a problem with VSCode or JSDoc or Mentioned Module, but I do care about VSCode, so I'm reporting this.

Here is the Result:
![jsdoc](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9999208/25797963/a1e18bd0-33f4-11e7-92d2-2b7d1aed3f23.png)

As you can see VSCode shows this error as a problem in my code:
`Supplied parameters do not match any signature of call target.`
I was following module guide (and the code was running well) so I took a look at the module code. Following is the method that I was calling from that module:
![safejson](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9999208/25798220/8ad0a5a6-33f5-11e7-9ff4-c7f6ea3e9b66.png)
(Whole file is available in here: https://github.com/evanshortiss/safejson/blob/848fcc7d8273f99fa783d2f27e2f57d2cc581a7c/src/index.js)

As you can see JSDoc documents/comments in module look fine. So, as I said before, I'm not really sure if this is a problem with VSCode. I'll be glad to read your opinions about this.

Regards

data.title: Feature request: filter on Explorer
data.body: I would like to have filter on explorer, the same as `Ctrl+ ;` from Visual studio.

data.title: Git extensions seems to open files with incorrect casing in its path
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (688b96f7dfa37b53b88eec4e6cb9af75a499fe86, 2017-05-05T15:34:02.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16188
---

On my machine my code is in `C:\Users\Eric\Code\*`.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a workspace (e.g. `C:\Users\Eric\Code\vscode-gitlens`)
2. Open a file (say `src\extension.ts`) -- note that the path of the opened file is `C:\Users\Eric\Code\vscode-gitlens\src\extension.ts`
3. Edit the file and save (just to get a change in the SCM viewlet)
4. Right-click on the file in the SCM viewlet and choose `Open File`
5. Another tab (preview) will open (even with `"workbench.editor.revealIfOpen": true`) -- note that the path of the opened file is `C:\Users\Eric\code\vscode-gitlens\src\extension.ts` -- the `C` in `Code` is now `c`

So now there are 2 editors open for the same file -- but code thinks they are different files.

Also to make the issue worse, when 2 editors are open like this -- using the search viewlet will duplicate matching results across these 2 files. I kept randomly running across duplicate search results, but finally was able to track down how it happens.

data.title: Explorer not working in insiders
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (688b96f7dfa37b53b88eec4e6cb9af75a499fe86, 2017-05-05T15:34:02.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the explorer. It displays nothing.

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/25791829/ce2094c0-3377-11e7-8435-4343edc6efbc.PNG)

2. Close the explorer. The result is a graphical bug.

![cap2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/25791832/d2221c60-3377-11e7-8d7c-7fd3ff91f339.PNG)

3. Open the explorer and try to switch to another view. The other icon gets highlighted but the panel doesn't change from explorer view.

![cap3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19817004/25791833/d57a4ca2-3377-11e7-98e8-c8c0c7b2ab91.PNG)

4. Open any of the other panels again. The view now switches correctly and the sidebar also hides correctly.

5. Switching back to explorer view breaks things again.

data.title: Feature Request - Git option to disable auto stage
data.body:
Would love to have an option to disable git from auto staging and committing all files incase a file was not staged in GUI. I have run into this, a couple of times when I forget to stage one file and all the unstaged changes get committed which is kind of annoying.

It would be a nice little quality of life improvement feature to have in settings
